Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 25 for SLE 12 SP4)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 25 for SLE 12 SP4)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-95_93 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2022-27666: Fixed a buffer overflow vulnerability in IPsec ESP transformation code. This flaw allowed a local attacker with a normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause a local privilege escalation. (bnc#1197462)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP4

Vulnerabilities.Description: A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in IPsec ESP transformation code in net/ipv4/esp4.c and net/ipv6/esp6.c. This flaw allows a local attacker with a normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause a local privilege escalation threat.
